vehicle.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck
vehicle.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: a description of the stolen vehicle
vehicle.translation[0].definitions[1].de: something you use to express and spread your ideas, opinions etc
vehicle.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The 1936 Olympics were used as a vehicle for Nazi propaganda.
‘Eastern Eye’ is an important vehicle for Black British opinion.
vehicle.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a film, television programme etc that is made to gain public attention for one of the people in it
vehicle.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: MGM made the film as a star vehicle for Brando.
This is the perfect vehicle for Fleming to make his triumphant return to the stage.
vehicle.translation[1].definitions[0].de: something used as a way of achieving a particular result
vehicle.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The subsidiary is expected to become the primarygrowth vehicle for the company.
Corporations are more efficient vehicles for reinvestment than partnerships.
vehicle.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Mutual funds are an appropriate vehicle for investors who don’t want to lock their money up.
Analysts see the stock market as the investment vehicle of choice this year.
